entry.title: So I Guess I'm Making a 4D Game Now...

media:group.media:title: So I Guess I'm Making a 4D Game Now...
media:group.media:description:
This is the first of a new Devlog series about the development of my untitled 4D game. More details to come in the next video, but check out the FAQ section below for more details.
Hyperbolica is now on the Oculus/Meta Quest Store! Quest Store: https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/4873486596022103 Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1256230/Hyperbolica/ Itch: https://codeparade.itch.io/hyperbolica
Support me and innovative projects like these! Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/codeparade Ko-fi: https://ko-fi.com/codeparade Merch: https://crowdmade.com/collections/codeparade
FAQ Q - What game engine are you using? A - Unity (with major hacks much like Hyperbolica) Q - Will you support VR? Or anaglyph? A - Maybe. Q - How much will the game cost? A - Very cheap (a few dollars) but probably not free. Q - Do you have a release date? A - Not Yet.
Music (CC BY-SA) Nesh Carrot - Hilltops https://billcornwell.co.uk/music.html Vani - Sueño Rosa https://setega.bandcamp.com/album/mmxvii

media:group.media:title: Dialog System - Hyperbolica Devlog #7
media:group.media:description:
Just a quick detour to show how Hyperbolica's dialog system works. With nearly 1000 NPCs, a custom dialog system and language was developed to simplify the process.
Hyperbolica on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1256230/Hyperbolica/ Join my discord: https://discord.gg/P9taqBJKJq Merch: https://crowdmade.com/collections/codeparade Support me on Patreon or Ko-fi: https://www.patreon.com/codeparade https://ko-fi.com/codeparade

entry.title: Pushing Unity To The Limit - Hyperbolica Devlog #6

media:group.media:title: Pushing Unity To The Limit - Hyperbolica Devlog #6
media:group.media:description:
Choosing to use Unity instead of building a custom engine saves a lot of development time, but it comes at the cost of excessive hacking to bend the engine to my will. These are just a few examples of Unity hacks I needed to do to get Hyperbolica working.
This is part 6 of the Hyperbolica Devlog series. Full playlist here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLh9DXIT3m6N4qJK9GKQB3yk61tVe6qJvA
Hyperbolica on steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1256230/Hyperbolica/ Join my discord: https://discord.gg/P9taqBJKJq Merch: https://crowdmade.com/collections/codeparade Support me on Patreon or Ko-fi: https://www.patreon.com/codeparade https://ko-fi.com/codeparade

media:group.media:description:

media:group.media:title: Humanoid - An Abandoned Game
media:group.media:description:
Humanoid is probably the largest abandoned project of mine. It was a retro-style adventure game, but it was eventually scrapped when I started moving on to other projects. So this video aims to at least document this otherwise unknown project.
Q: "Can I download or play this game?" A: It's not a finished game, and a lot of scenes from the video had to be hacked to access different rooms or events. It's not in a 'demo-able' state, and I don't have the time yet to get it there. I may open source the engine at some point, but I don't know if it's really that useful with no support or documentation, and I would not recommend anyone to use it anyway (that's already a hard lesson learned for me).
Q: Hyperbolica? A: Yes. Still working on it, and I still don't have an expected release date yet. It will be ready when it's done.
Music By Razerek "Suspended In Midair" https://soundcloud.com/razerek/suspended-in-mid-air "Rattlesnake Pond" https://soundcloud.com/razerek/rattlesnake_pondit-s3xmoditmania-round-1 "Aftermath Of The Tremors At Vinegar Lake" https://soundcloud.com/razerek/aftermath-of-the-tremors-at-vinegar-lake https://razerek.bandcamp.com/ https://twitter.com/Razerek_

media:group.media:title: Sounds of the Mandelbrot Set
media:group.media:description:
Try it out now! https://codeparade.itch.io/fractal-sound-explorer Making music and sound effects directly from common fractals was an idea I though of one night, so I just had to try it out to see what it would be like. The results were really interesting and actually helped me understand even more about fractals and chaos.
Source Code: https://github.com/HackerPoet/FractalSoundExplorer
If you like the things I do and want to support the channel: https://www.patreon.com/codeparade https://ko-fi.com/codeparade
If you're a fractal fan, you'll be interested in my other fractal videos too. The playlist is here: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLh9DXIT3m6N7n4R60eJGPPPnn5LvTXQLY
Music (CC BY 4.0): Meydän - Underwater https://meydan.bandcamp.com/album/underwater https://meydanrecords.com/

media:group.media:title: Non-Euclidean 3D Modeling - Hyperbolica Devlog #5
media:group.media:description:
Modeling 3D geometry for non-euclidean spaces presents some real challenges! To explain how we accomplished this is the artist himself; João Kalva. This is the 5th Hyperbolica Devlog and my first video with a guest speaker. To catch-up from the beginning, you should start here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zQo_S3yNa2w
Hyperbolica on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1256230/Hyperbolica/ Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EMKLeS-Uq_8 Discord Server: https://discord.gg/7fAwnYV Merch: https://crowdmade.com/collections/codeparade
00:00 - Introduction 00:44 - Horizontal Distortion 01:30 - Vertical Distortion 02:30 - Geometry 03:38 - Color 04:35 - Why Low Poly 04:52 - Conclusion
João Kalva ArtStation: https://www.artstation.com/joaokalva YouTube [Portuguese]: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC94uepLm17MVxx05RBFbJgg/videos
If you like the things I do and want to support the channel: https://www.patreon.com/codeparade https://ko-fi.com/codeparade
Music By Phil K. https://willcomposeforfood.com/

media:group.media:title: Projecting Space - Hyperbolica Devlog #4
media:group.media:description:
In this 4th installment, we'll go beyond the camera and dive into the tricky nuances of dealing with hyperbolic and spherical rendering, how to achieve them in a traditional rendering pipeline, and working with gravity in a hyperbolic world.
Previous Devlogs: Devlog #1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zQo_S3yNa2w Devlog #2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yY9GAyJtuJ0 Devlog #3: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pXWRYpdYc7Q
Hyperbolica on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1256230/Hyperbolica/ Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EMKLeS-Uq_8 Discord Server: https://discord.gg/7fAwnYV Merch: https://crowdmade.com/collections/codeparade
If you like the things I do and want to support the channel: https://www.patreon.com/codeparade https://ko-fi.com/codeparade

media:group.media:title: Hyperbolica Release Delayed
media:group.media:description:
Unfortunately the release date is getting pushed back a little bit, but the quality improvements during that time should hopefully be worth the extra wait. I really want to make sure this to looks and plays like a full, polished game, and not just a tech demo. Next devlog will be coming soon!
Hyperbolica on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1256230/Hyperbolica/ Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EMKLeS-Uq_8 Discord Server: https://discord.gg/7fAwnYV

media:group.media:title: Rendering Hyperbolic Spaces - Hyperbolica Devlog #3
media:group.media:description:
This is the 3rd devlog for Hyperbolica where I talk about how I build and render hyperbolic worlds. If you haven't seen the first 2 videos in the series, make sure you watch them first or else this may be confusing.
Devlog #1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zQo_S3yNa2w Devlog #2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yY9GAyJtuJ0
Hyperbolica on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1256230/Hyperbolica/ Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EMKLeS-Uq_8 Discord Server: https://discord.gg/7fAwnYV Merch: https://crowdmade.com/collections/codeparade
If you like the things I do and want to support the channel: https://www.patreon.com/codeparade https://ko-fi.com/codeparade
**CORRECTIONS:** I just found out that Gyrovectors are indeed associative. I misunderstood the context of the claim in the paper, which was referring to mobius addition, not the full gyrovector addition which corrects the associativity. I apologize for the mistake!
Other references from video: Miegakure: https://miegakure.com/ Ungar's original paper about Gyrovector Spaces: https://www.researchgate.net/publication/268710591_Gyrovector_spaces_and_their_differential_geometry
Music: Horrible - Mela https://melagroup.bandcamp.com/album/mela-two
